metadata.source: W. O. Kermack, A. G. McKendrick; Laboratory of the Royal College of Physicians, Edinburgh
metadata.knowledge: Kermack, W. O., & McKendrick, A. G. (1927). A contribution to the mathematical theory of epidemics. Proceedings of the Royal Society of London. Series A, Containing papers of a mathematical and physical character, 115(772), 700-721.
metadata.name: SIR Model
metadata.description: S, I and R represent the number of susceptible, infected, and recovered individuals, and N = S + I + R is the total population. The infectious rate, β, controls the rate of spread which represents the probability of transmitting disease between a susceptible and an infectious individual. Recovery rate, γ = 1/D, is determined by the average duration, D, of infection.

metadata.name: Susceptible
metadata.description: Population of people who are susceptible to be infected

metadata.name: Infected
metadata.description: Population of people who are infected
metadata.expression: (beta * Infected * Susceptible / (Susceptible + Infected + Recovered)) + gamma * Infected

metadata.name: Recovered
metadata.description: Population of people who recovered (and have immunity now)

metadata.name: Recovery Rate
metadata.description: The recovery rate, 1/D, determined by the average duration, D, of infection.

metadata.name: Rate of Spread
metadata.description: The probability of transmitting disease between a susceptible and an infectious individual.
